derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Portuguese melaço, from late Latin mellacium 'must', based on mel 'honey'

entry.def: Molasses is a thick, dark brown syrup which is produced when sugar is processed. It is used in cooking.

means.word_mean: 1. thick dark syrup produced by boiling down juice from sugar cane; especially during sugar refining
